answers.answer: First off I think the diabetic diet is a good one for everyone to follow, well balanced and good portions.  I have been diabetic for 25 years and have two children.  I had worries like yours about my children getting diabetes too.  So far so good, no signs or symptoms of either child getting diabetes.  There is no one else in my family with the disease.  I am not an expert on genetics or if your son is more susceptable or not of getting diabetes.  I am also no expert on gestational diabetes either.  You could ask your doctor for advice-I assume you go to an endocronologist.  Ask your son's pediatrician.  You could go on-line and look for info-but be careful sometimes sites are only advertisements-I like JDRF.org or American Diabetes Association has some good stuff too.I also think you are doing a good job by being a good example of a healthy person-eating right--I assume you keep active and introduce your son to a variety of activities too. Exercise is also key to maintaining good control of diabetes.  I walk everyday.  I take my kids to the park, we play and I teach them how to swim, play sports.  I love to be active and they love it too.If you keep up the good work and provide a good solid example of a well balanced healthy person your child will probably inherit your good habits too. I try not to worry too much about things I don't have control of but the things I can control I do the best I can.  And I am trying to make sure I introduce more healthy choices in my own diet and my kids' diets too!

question: I developed Gestational Diabetes while pregnant with my son. Despite delivery, I am still a diabetic. Therefore, the whole family enjoys a diabetic diet. My son (Jake) is now 2
title: Gestational Diabetes and the inpact on the child
